body:
switching from toxcore 0.1.7 to 0.1.9 bootstrapd does not compile.
do i need to change anything?


https://circleci.com/gh/zoff99/ToxCam/79:

```
libtool: link: arm-linux-gnueabihf-gcc -std=gnu99 -I/home/ubuntu/src//c-toxcore/other/bootstrap_daemon -I/home/ubuntu/cc/tools/arm-bcm2708/arm-rpi-4.9.3-linux-gnueabihf/arm-linux-gnueabihf/sysroot/usr/include -g -O2 -o .libs/tox-bootstrapd ../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-command_line_arguments.o ../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-config.o ../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-log.o ../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-tox-bootstrapd.o ../other/tox_bootstrapd-bootstrap_node_packets.o  ./.libs/libtoxcore.so -L/home/ubuntu/cc/tools/arm-bcm2708/arm-rpi-4.9.3-linux-gnueabihf/arm-linux-gnueabihf/sysroot/usr/lib -L/home/ubuntu/cc/tools/arm-bcm2708/arm-rpi-4.9.3-linux-gnueabihf/arm-linux-gnueabihf/sysroot/usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabihf -lconfig /home/ubuntu/cc/tools/arm-bcm2708/arm-rpi-4.9.3-linux-gnueabihf/arm-linux-gnueabihf/sysroot/usr/lib/libsodium.a -pthread -Wl,-rpath -Wl,/home/ubuntu/cc/tools/arm-bcm2708/arm-rpi-4.9.3-linux-gnueabihf/arm-linux-gnueabihf/sysroot/usr/lib
../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-log.o: In function `log_open':
/home/ubuntu/src//c-toxcore/build/../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/log.c:46: undefined reference to `log_backend_syslog_open'
../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-log.o: In function `log_close':
/home/ubuntu/src//c-toxcore/build/../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/log.c:65: undefined reference to `log_backend_syslog_close'
../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-log.o: In function `log_write':
/home/ubuntu/src//c-toxcore/build/../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/log.c:90: undefined reference to `log_backend_syslog_write'
/home/ubuntu/src//c-toxcore/build/../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/log.c:86: undefined reference to `log_backend_stdout_write'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

comment_data.body:
What build system do you use, CMake or autotools?

Edit: oh, didn't notice the circle-ci link.

On the quick glance, our Travis-CI builds tox-bootstrapd just fine with both [CMake](https://travis-ci.org/TokTok/c-toxcore/jobs/241397646) and [autotools](https://travis-ci.org/TokTok/c-toxcore/jobs/241397645).

It seems to be an issue on your end. I'm not totally sure how your Circle-CI build is setup, it looks like a very very very wrong way of building something. The issue comes from the hardcoded command

```sh
. ~/pp; cd /home/ubuntu/build/build ; export V=3 ; /bin/bash ../libtool --tag=CC --mode=link $CC -std=gnu99 -I/home/ubuntu/src//c-toxcore/other/bootstrap_daemon -I"$_SYSROOT_"/usr/include -g -O2 -o tox-bootstrapd ../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-command_line_arguments.o ../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-config.o ../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-log.o ../other/bootstrap_daemon/src/tox_bootstrapd-tox-bootstrapd.o ../other/tox_bootstrapd-bootstrap_node_packets.o libtoxcore.la -L"$_SYSROOT_"/usr/lib -L"$_SYSROOT_"/usr/lib/arm-linux-gnueabihf -lconfig -lsodium
```

which is missing mentioning of several `.o` files corresponding to new source files of tox-bootstrapd introduced in the latest version of c-toxcore.

I suggest you create a CMake toolchain file for cross-compiling to arm and remove all those commands with hardcoded object files. That way you can use cmake like you would normally do, without need to keep up-to-date with all new source files project introduces.

Here is an example of one we use for cross-compiling to Windows

```CMake
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME Windows)

SET(CMAKE_C_COMPILER   x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc)
SET(CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER x86_64-w64-mingw32-g++)
SET(CMAKE_RC_COMPILER  x86_64-w64-mingw32-windres)

SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH /usr/x86_64-w64-mingw32 /home/jenkins/workspace/libtoxcore-toktok_build_windows_x86-64_static_release/dependencies)
```
        
It's saved as `windows_toolchain.cmake` and then cmake is called with `-DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=windows_toolchain.cmake` argument.

i am building bootstrapd for raspberrypi. it does not build on its own.
seems between 0.1.7 and 0.1.9 syslog lib depedency was added or some logging lib.. is that so?

No, syslog was used all along, in 0.1.7 and even before the versioning has began.

Anyway, I have explained what the issue exactly is, not sure why you are asking more questions, you should be able to just fix it now.
i know how to fix it. i would like to know what changed and why

I already said what has changed: there were several new source files added to tox-bootstrapd in 0.1.9. As to why they were added, [the PR that has added them](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/pull/487) might be able to answer that.

title: switching from toxcore 0.1.7 to 0.1.9 bootstrapd does not compile
